TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Click on the button to continue.
Click on each part of the microscope for a closer view.
Switch ON the light source, the switch is placed at the base of the microscope.
Adjust the light intensity with the help of a lamp rheostat.
Place a microscopic slide on the stage.
Rotate the nosepiece to the lowest-power objective,i.e., 4x objective lens(objective lens with red band).
Observe through the microscope and move the Iris diaphragm lever, till most of the light comes through or the background becomes brighter.
Close 3/4th of the iris diaphragm.
Adjust the coarse adjustment knob until the specimen is in focus.
Rotate the fine adjustment knob till the image becoming clearer with good resolution.The image can be seen as above.
Rotate the nosepiece to the 10x objective (lens with the yellow band) for 100x magnification.
Open half the iris diaphragm.
Adjust the coarse adjustment knob until the specimen is in focus.
Rotate the fine adjustment knob till the image becoming clearer with good resolution.The image can be seen as above.
Rotate nose piece to 40x objective (lens with the blue band).
Open ¾ th of the iris diaphragm.
Focus the lens using coarse adjustment knob.
Rotate the fine adjustment knob until the image becomes clearer with good resolution. The image can be seen as above.

Rotate nose piece such that the specimen is between 40x and 100x objective. Place a small drop of oil on the slide in the centre of the lighted area. Rotate nose piece so that the 100x oil immersion objective (lens with the white band) touches the oil.
Open the iris diaphragm completely.
Only fine adjustment is done.The Image will appear as above.
Remove the slide and wipe the 100x oil immersion objective carefully with lens paper to remove all oil.
